title: The Kingdom Divides
summary: Rehoboam becomes king and refuses to lighten the burdens his father placed on the people. As a result, ten tribes rebel and form the northern kingdom of Israel under Jeroboam, leaving Rehoboam with only Judah and Benjamin.

faq.question: Why did the kingdom split?
faq.answer: Because Rehoboam rejected wise counsel and spoke harshly to the people.

faq.question: Who became king of the northern tribes?
faq.answer: Jeroboam, ruling the new kingdom of Israel.
